hawaiian_text: O Kalelealuaka a me Keinohoomanawanui, i ko laua ala ana i ke kakahiaka a hele iwaho o ka hale, iko iho la laua he pahoa e ku ana ma ka puka o ka hale, ua kukuluia. I aku o Keinohoomanawanui ia Kalelealuaka: “Make kaua! Eia la he pahoa ma ka puka o ka hale o kaua! Ua loaa. Aloha ino kaua i ka make; o ka’u no ia e olelo aku ana ia oe e waiho ke ’lii, aohe make olelo.”
reference_translation: When Kalelealuaka and Keinohoomanawanui woke up in the morning and went out of doors, they saw a wooden dagger sticking in the ground just outside of the entrance. At seeing this Keinohoomanawanui said to Kalelealuaka: “We are going to be killed. Here is a wooden dagger at our door. We have been discovered. What a pity that we are to be killed. You can now see the consequences of disobeying my advice, not to speak anything in connection with the king.”
mistral-Small-3.1-24B-ud-q4kxl-maui_tran:
To translate the given Hawaiian text to English, let's break it down step by step:

1. **O Kalelealuaka a me Keinohoomanawanui, i ko laua ala ana i ke kakahiaka a hele iwaho o ka hale** - "Kalelealuaka and Keinohoomanawanui, as they were going in the morning and leaving the house"
2. **iko iho la laua he pahoa e ku ana ma ka puka o ka hale, ua kukuluia.** - "they saw a fire standing at the entrance of the house, which had been built."
3. **I aku o Keinohoomanawanui ia Kalelealuaka: “Make kaua! Eia la he pahoa ma ka puka o ka hale o kaua! Ua loaa.** - "Keinohoomanawanui said to Kalelealuaka: 'We are dead! Here is a fire at the entrance of our house! It has been obtained.'
4. **Aloha ino kaua i ka make; o ka’u no ia e olelo aku ana ia oe e waiho ke ’lii, aohe make olelo.”** - "We have great affection for death; it is yours who say to leave the chief, there is no death in words."

Putting it all together, the translation is:

<translation>Kalelealuaka and Keinohoomanawanui, as they were going in the morning and leaving the house, saw a fire standing at the entrance of the house, which had been built. Keinohoomanawanui said to Kalelealuaka: 'We are dead! Here is a fire at the entrance of our house! It has been obtained. We have great affection for death; it is yours who say to leave the chief, there is no death in words.'</translation>
